timeline.body:
```suggestion
  An identifier for the database management system (DBMS) product being used.
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
/** Database type. For any SQL database, "sql". For others, the lower-case database category. */
An identifier for the database management system (DBMS) product being used.
timeline.author: thisthat

timeline.body: `db.url` was removed from the semantic conventions
timeline.bodyText: db.url was removed from the semantic conventions
timeline.bodyHTML: db.url was removed from the semantic conventions
timeline.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: Good point, but this is required when making a connection.  Maybe it was missing from the database.md?
replies.author: heyams

replies.bodyText: I just realized i added db_connection_string, i can remove db_url.  Please confirm if that's what you meant.  @thisthat
replies.author: heyams

timeline.body:
I think this comment is out of date, the list of identifiers has e.g., mysql, postgresql now. How about linking to the list?

https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/trace/semantic_conventions/database.md#notes-and-well-known-identifiers-for-dbsystem
timeline.bodyText:

timeline.body:
```suggestion
   * For db.system == mssql, the instance name connecting to. This
   * name is used to determine the port of a named instance. When set, {@link #NET_PEER_PORT} is not required
   * but recommended when connecting to a non-standard port.
   */
```

timeline.body:
```suggestion
   * For JDBC clients, the fully-qualified class name of the
   * Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) driver used to connect, e.g. "org.postgresql.Driver" or
   * "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver".
```
timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * Connection-level attributes for specific technologies. The fully-qualified class name of the
          
          
            
               * Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) driver used to connect, e.g. "org.postgresql.Driver" or
          
          
            
               * "com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver".
          
          
            
               * For JDBC clients, the fully-qualified class name of the
          
          
            
               * Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) driver used to connect, e.g. "org.postgresql.Driver" or

* For JDBC clients, the fully-qualified class name of the
